intro: Pabstiella crenata, commonly known as the crested pabstiella, is a rare and unique species of flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants, and is characterized by its distinctive, hairy leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as along stream banks or in humid forests. Its botanical features include a short, woody stem and small, alternate leaves with a serrated edge. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Pabstiella crenata is considered a species of conservation concern.
